subtasks.hazard: COLLISION WITH MILITARY OR CIVILIAN MOTOR VEHICLES

values: HHT WILL MOVE IN PLATOON SIZED ELEMENTS IOT MINIMIZE THE POSSIBILITY OF COLLISIONS.
EACH VEHICLE WILL HAVE AN FM RADIO AND ADHERE TO 50-100 m INTERVALS BETWEEN VEHICLES.
WILL ADHERE TO SQDN SOP REGARDING VC AND REAR GUARD AWARENESS.
CONVOY SAFETY BRIEF, RAMP BRIEF
CONVOY COMMANDER, VCs, RSO, ALL LEADERS
ALL EQUIPMENT WILL BE SECURED AND TIED DOWN
ALL LEADERS WILL PUT HANDS ON ALL SENSITIVE ITEMS BEFORE LEAVING RANGE
PCCs/PCIs, HANDS ON SENSITIVE ITEMS
OIC, NCOIC, RSO
SOLDIERS WILL BE GIVEN AN IN-DEPTH SAFETY BRIEF CONCERNING ROAD SAFETY
LEADERS WILL MONITOR SOLDIERS AND VEHICLE OPERATIONS.
LEADERS ENSURES A REST PLAN IS IN PLACE TO ENSURE DRIVERS ARE PREPARED TO OPERATE VEHICLES
SAFTEY BRIEF, RAMP BRIEF, PLATOON LEADERSHIP
OIC, RSO, ALL LEADERS

EACH SOLDIER WILL BE ISSUED AMMUNITION ONLY PRIOR TO EXECUTION. UPON COMPLETION OF THE LANE EACH SOLDIER WILL BE FUNNELED THROUGH A CHOKE POINT WHERE ALL AMMUNITION WILL BE TURNED INTO THE ASP, AND EACH SOLDIER'S WEAPON AND MAGAZINES WILL BE INSPECTED FOR AMMUNTION.
SAFETY BRIEF, PCC/PCI/CHOKE POINT AT ASP
RSO, SAFETIES, SOLDIERS
SOLDIERS WILL USE SELECTOR SWITCH DISCIPLINE AND ONLY PLACE THE WEAPON SYSTEM ON FIRE PRIOR TO ENGAGING TARGETS.
UPON COMPLETION OF EACH ENGAGEMENT, SELECTOR SWITCHES WILL BE PLACED ON SAFE..
SAFETY BRIEF, SPOT CHECKS
ALL LEADERS

subtasks.hazard: RICHOCHET, WEAPON ORIENTED OTHER THAN DOWNRANGE

values: FULL DRAGOON STANDARD WILL BE WORN WHEN ON THE FIRING LINE DURING EXECUTION OF M17 QUALS.
SOLDIERS BRIEFED REGARDING BOTH POSSIBILILITY OF RICHOCHET AND IMPORTANCE OF MAINTAINING MUZZLE DISCIPLINE.
SAFETY BRIEF, RANGE CONSTRUCTION, SPOT CHECKS
RSO, SAFETIES, SOLDIERS
ANY SOLDIER WHO IDENTIFIES WILDLIFE ON THE RANGE DURING LIVE FIRE WILL IMMEDIETLY CALL CEASE FIRE
SOLIDERS WILL NOT INTERACT WITH OR TOUCH ANY WILDLIFE
RSO WILL CONDUCT BRIEFING OUTLINING POTENTIAL WILDLIFE HAZARDS
SAFETY BRIEF
OIC/RSO, SOLDIERS
IMMEDIATE ACTION WILL BE PERFORMED, FOLLOWED BY REMEDIAL ACTION. IF WEAPON MALFUNCTION CONTINUES AFTER REMEDIAL ACTION, LEVEL 20 ARMORERS WILL BE CALLED TO CHECK WEAPON SYSTEM.
SAFETY BRIEF, LANE SAFETIES
OIC/RSO, SOLDIERS, LANE SAFETIES
SOLDIERS WILL BE BRIEFED ON WEATHER CFONDITIONS AND CARRRY APPROFPRIATE EQUIPMENT.
REFRESHER CLASS ON SIGNS OF HEAT/COLD WEATHER INJURIES.
OIC/RSO WILL DICTATE UNIFORM STANDARD. NCOS ENFORCE THOSE STANDARDS TO REDUCE THREAT OF HEAT/COLD RELATED INJURIES
SAFETY BRIEF AND PCC/PCIS
OIC, RSO, ALL LEADERS, MEDICS
RSO WILL WALK THE RANGE WITH LANE SAFETIES AND VERIFY ALL BRASS HAS BEEN POLICED.
SAFETY BRIEF, LANE SAFETIES
RSO, LANE SAFTIES, ASP NCOIC
SOLDIERS WILL FOLLOW PROPER HANGFIRE PROCEDURES, CONTINUING TO AIM THE WEAPON DOWNRANGE UNTIL A SAFETY CAN CLEAR THE SOLDIER.
MISFIRE AMMUNITION WILL BE SEPARATED AND TURNED IN AS A MISFIRE
RANGE AND SAFTEY BRIEF
RANGE SAFETIES, RSO, ALL LEADERS

draw.overall_supervision_plan: OIC and RSO will orient soldiers to the range and conduct a safety brief. Soldiers will coach/safety each other on the firing line with NCO's safetying in a 1:1 ratio. OIC and RSO will continuously monitor all aspects of the Qualification. Newly Identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be improved at the appropriate level. Every Soldier will be considered a safety, if they see an unsafe act they will call a cease fire and notify everyone to stop training.
